intro: Phelypaea carnosa, commonly known as the woolly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that gives it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Native to the temperate regions of South America, particularly Chile and Argentina, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with a leathery texture and dark green coloration. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
